level off/out.translation[0].definitions: to stop going up or down and continue at the same height
After climbing steeply, the path levelled off.
The plane levelled out at 30,000 feet.
to stop rising or falling and become steady
Inflation has begun to level off.
to make something flat and smooth
level off/out.translation[1].definitions: to stop increasing or growing and become steady or continue at a fixed level
Lower mortgage rates should help the market to level out.
Short-term interest rates will level off later this year.
